t: Psalm 50
God Himself Is Judge
A Psalm of Asaph.
The*pn Mighty One, God the Lord,*s speaks*ld and summons the earth from*ld the rising of the sun to its setting.
Out*ln of Zion, the perfection of beauty, God*ld shines forth.
Our*pn God comes; he does not keep silence; before*ld him is a devouring fire, around*ld him a mighty tempest.
He*ln calls to the heavens above and*ld to the earth, that he may judge his people:
“Gather*ln to me my faithful ones, who*ld made a covenant with me by sacrifice!”
The*ln heavens declare his righteousness, for*ld God himself is judge! Selah*ig
“Hear,*pn O my people, and I will speak; O*ld Israel, I will testify against you. I*ld am God, your God.
Not*ln for your sacrifices do I rebuke you; your*ld burnt offerings are continually before me.
I*ln will not accept a bull from your house or*ld goats from your folds.
For*ln every beast of the forest is mine, the*ld cattle on a thousand hills.
I*ln know all the birds of the hills, and*ld all that moves in the field is mine.
“If*pn I were hungry, I would not tell you, for*ld the world and its fullness are mine.
Do*ln I eat the flesh of bulls or*ld drink the blood of goats?
Offer*ln to God a sacrifice of thanksgiving, and*ld perform your vows to the Most High,
and*ln call upon me in the day of trouble; I*ld will deliver you, and you shall glorify me.”
But*pn to the wicked God says: “What*ld right have you to recite my statutes or*ld take my covenant on your lips?
For*ln you hate discipline, and*ld you cast my words behind you.
If*ln you see a thief, you are pleased with him, and*ld you keep company with adulterers.
“You*pn give your mouth free rein for evil, and*ld your tongue frames deceit.
You*ln sit and speak against your brother; you*ld slander your own mother’s son.
These*ln things you have done, and I have been silent; you*ld thought that I was one like yourself. But*ln now I rebuke you and lay the charge before you.
“Mark*pn this, then, you who forget God, lest*ld I tear you apart, and there be none to deliver!
The*ln one who offers thanksgiving as his sacrifice glorifies me; to*ld one who orders his way rightly I*ld will show the salvation of God!”
